content.description:
This climbs the big overhang around the left side from

Cronus

. Start on some edges down low, and climb up and a bit left into the big jugs above.
content.location: It ascends the center/left of the overhang.

content.description: Start on two crimps, make a big cross move, and then climb more big moves on jugs. It climbs better than it might look from the ground, and the holds avoid all of the chossier rock out left.
content.location: It ascends the arete to the left of the roof on the Cronus Bloc.

content.description: Sit start compressed on two good holds. Make a move to the large jug feature, and find your way up the arete.
content.location: From the downhill side of the boulder, this is the back right arete. It is the same start as “Hybris”

content.description: Start compressed down and left on two good holds. Climb to a jug and then out right to a big, triangular hol,d and then continue to follow the slanted rail to the top.
content.location: It is on the backside of the boulder. If you’re facing downhill, this starts on the left corner. Start sitting beneath the arete.

content.description:
This is a really fun way for a beginner to get to the top of a huge boulder.

It’s also the easiest way up to scope the topouts of other lines.
content.location: It ascends the arete on the right side of the big overhang. Climb up on good rock into the topout slab.

content.description:
Cronus is beautiful, tall, and committing with amazing rock and sculpted holds the entire way.

Start on a juggy edge and climb up the arete.

This should be looked at as a no fall situation from the start. It drops off steeply and would likely send you tumbling into the trees.

If you are confident at the grade or are willing to work the moves out on a rope, you should get on this thing.
content.protection: Not falling, or many pads and a couple strong spotters.
content.location: This is the line facing down hill that you see as you approach from Megatron/Stematron.
